content: temperature snake this pattern is inspired by „the boa snake by lisa sommers on ravelry please go check out their pattern because i ll refer to some parts of it here https //ravel me/crochet-boa-snake materials  whatever yarn you like + corresponding hook i used 4/8 friends cotton by hobbii weight 1 super fine and a 2mm hook  a smaller hook and yarn for the tongue i used a 1mm crochet hook and red crochet thread  safety eyes or embroider the eyes use felt etc i used 6mm safety eyes  polyfill or other filling material  yarn needle  stitch marker abbreviations  r x row number x  single_crochet single_crochet  magic_ring magic_ring  increase increase  decrease invisible decrease  slip_stitch slip_stitch  st stitch  f/o fasten o cid 431  … * n repeat … n times  n total stitch count per round n stitches  standing single_crochet standing single_crochet you can search for youtube tutorial or make a slip knot then just single_crochet that s my way of explaining  invisible join after f/o take your yarn a yarn needle and trace the top of next stitch to create a seamless round join pattern tongue slip knot leave a tail to secure chain 13 starting in 2nd chain from hook slip_stitch 5 chain 6 starting in 2nd chain from hook slip_stitch 5 then in the remaining 7 chain from 12 chain slip_stitch 7 f/o and leave a tail to secure later -you may want to adjust the chain 13 and the remaining chain part and make a shorter or longer tongue depending on how big your snake head & body is head r1 in magic_ring single_crochet 6 6 r2 increase 6 12 r3-4 single_crochet 12 12 i would attach the tongue now bring the two ends through the middle of the magic_ring or between r1 and r2 right where your end of the round is so the tongue ends up slightly below the tip of the snout then using a yarn needle secure the ends by tying a knot around a loop of a nearby stitch r5 single_crochet increase *6 18 after r10 my snek r6-8 single_crochet 18 18 looks like r9 single_crochet increase single_crochet *6 24 this r10 single_crochet 24 24 and now that you are at 24 single_crochet go and check out the snake pattern i got inspired by https //ravel me/crochet-boa-snake i just continue r11 and r12 of the linked pattern after that i do 4 rounds of 36 single_crochet then r23 and r24 of the linked pattern you now did r11-r18 and then back to my pattern r 19 single_crochet 29 slip_stitch f/o then invisible join by tracing the first st of this round 30 now add your eyes i place my safety eyes 8 or 9 st apart between r11 and r12 make sure you place them according to the head shape in a way that the flat part is the snake belly and stu cid
